keyword: how many calories are in a cookie
title: How Many Calories Are in a Cookie?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a cookie with our breakdown of nutrition facts, including carbs, fat, protein, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Cookie?
assumptions: Standard medium chocolate chip cookie (~30 g), baked with butter, flour, sugar, and chocolate chips; no nuts or fillings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, size, brand, ingredients, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard chocolate chip cookie has about 150 kcal and 2 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Oatmeal raisin instead of chocolate chip

faqs.q: How many calories are in a chocolate chip cookie?
faqs.a: About 150 kcal for a standard medium-sized one.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a cookie?
faqs.a: Roughly 19 g total carbs, including 11 g sugars and 1 g fiber.
Yes, around 7 g fat per cookie, with 4 g saturated.

faqs.q: How does cookie size affect calories?
faqs.a: Smaller cookies (~15 g) have ~75 kcal; larger ones (~45 g) up to 225 kcal.
Yes, by using oats, reducing butter, or opting for whole grain flour to cut ~20-50 kcal.
